While mood disturbances can occur in schizophrenia, mood stabilizers are not the primary treatment and are less effective than antipsychotics. Antidepressants may be used to manage comorbid conditions like depression, but they are not the primary treatment for schizophrenia itself. Anti-epileptics are not standard in the treatment of schizophrenia, as their role is unclear and not supported by consensus. The retrieved evidence paths confirm that schizophrenia causes psychotic disorders and symptoms, supporting the use of antipsychotics as the main treatment approach.
